meanings.definition: Blackwaters: plural noun - dark or murky water, typically found in swamps or marshes.
meanings.sent1: The explorers cautiously navigated the blackwaters of the swamp.
meanings.sent2: The blackwaters of the marsh reflected the overcast sky above.
meanings.sent3: The frogs croaked happily by the blackwaters, enjoying their dark and cozy home.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a deep blackwaters of thoughts, swirling and mysterious.
meanings.sent5: The blackwaters whispered secrets of the swamp's hidden creatures.

meanings.definition: Blackwaters: verb - to become dark or murky in color or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The once clear pond began to blackwaters after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The river blackwaters as the pollution levels increased.
meanings.sent3: The paint started to blackwaters on the old wooden fence, giving it a spooky look.
meanings.sent4: His mood seemed to blackwaters as the evening wore on.
meanings.sent5: The sky started to blackwaters, signaling an approaching storm.
